items.sentence: I suspect Tom and Mary have both already left Boston.
It seems unlikely that the train will arrive on time.
Practice is the only way to master foreign languages.
Men in kimonos are no longer a common sight in Tokyo.
You don't have to do anything that you don't want to.
Tom hoped that Mary wouldn't find out what he'd done.
Tom asked Mary if she wanted to go swimming with him.
For a man of seventy, he still has surprising vigour.
It wouldn't be polite to refuse to accept their gift.
Tom punched John in the stomach and then walked away.
I don't think that Tom knows when Mary's birthday is.
I don't think that Tom knows when Mary will be there.
The post office is located in the center of the town.
Tom opened his mouth to scream, but nothing came out.
Tom usually keeps all the windows open in the spring.
Tom took a key out of his pocket and opened the door.
The only thing I bought today was this pair of shoes.
Tom isn't any better at remembering things than I am.
Do you think that Tom might know Mary's phone number?
Can I borrow some money? I'll pay you back next week.
